Here are some recent articles on the impact of social media on mental health:

1. **"The Impact of Social Media on Mental Health"** by the American Psychological Association (APA) (2022)

This article summarizes the latest research on the effects of social media on mental health, including increased symptoms of depression, anxiety, and loneliness.

2. **"Social media use linked to depression in adults"** by CNN Health (2022)

This article reports on a study published in the Journal of Affective Disorders, which found that adults who used social media for more than 30 minutes per day were more likely to experience depression.

3. **"The Dark Side of Social Media: How It Affects Mental Health"** by Healthline (2022)

This article explores the ways in which social media can negatively impact mental health, including the pressure to present a perfect online image, cyberbullying, and sleep disturbances.

4. **"Social Media Use and Mental Health: A Systematic Review"** by the Journal of Adolescent Health (2022)

This systematic review of 36 studies on social media use and mental health finds that social media use is associated with increased symptoms of depression, anxiety, and poor sleep quality.

5. **"The Mental Health Effects of Social Media on Teens"** by the Child Mind Institute (2022)

This article discusses the unique challenges faced by teenagers on social media, including FOMO (fear of missing out), online harassment, and the impact on self-esteem.

6. **"Social media's impact on mental health: What's the evidence?"** by The Guardian (2022)

This article examines the evidence on the impact of social media on mental health, including the role of algorithms, social comparison, and the need for more research.

7. **"The Relationship Between Social Media and Depression"** by Verywell Mind (2022)

This article explores the complex relationship between social media use and depression, including the potential mechanisms underlying this association.

8. **"Social Media Use and Mental Health in Young Adults: A Longitudinal Study"** by the Journal of Youth and Adolescence (2022)

This longitudinal study finds that social media use is associated with increased symptoms of depression and anxiety in young adults, particularly among those who use social media more frequently.

9. **"The Impact of Social Media on Self-Esteem"** by Psychology Today (2022)

This article discusses the ways in which social media can affect self-esteem, including the promotion of unrealistic beauty standards, social comparison, and the fear of missing out.

10. **"Social Media, Mental Health, and the COVID-19 Pandemic"** by the National Institute of Mental Health (2022)

This article examines the impact of social media on mental health during the COVID-19 pandemic, including the potential benefits and drawbacks of social media use during this time.

I hope these articles are helpful!
